title: Love this bank!
text:
Monzo (USA customer) is absolutely wonderful, I’m so happy I found it!!

I hate how overly complex most banking apps are - too much noise, notifications, etc. I know myself, for me, less is more when it comes to my finances. Monzo is simple. No fees, no hoopla. I love their salary sorter. I can quickly sort my money into Pots - it’s very set it and forget it. Monzo is my absolute favorite bank!

They also has great customer support. I don’t think I’ve ever had a positive online chat experience in my life, but their chat team was superb!

title: Lots of potential
text: I like the instant funding option - very convenient. Setting certain transactions as repeating payments is a very nice feature for subscriptions and under the “Payments” tab you can see these recurring payments. I like that you can add notes, tags and receipts to every transaction. The budgeting tool is not very helpful to me personally, but the Trends feature is - it helps to see how you’re using your money. The Pots have a “scheduled payments” option, but it should really say “scheduled transfers” because Pots are not for making payments - they are just to set money aside. To use money from Pots you have to transfer it back to main account. If I could make payments directly from a “Bills” Pot with its own account number then “scheduled payments” would make sense and would be a very useful feature. Spend (checking), Savings and Bills - if I had a separate account number for these three along with some cash back or rewards options on purchases, it would be the perfect banking app for me. This app has a lot of potential.

title: Avoid. Awful service
text: I signed up for an account, and they sent my card to the wrong address. That’s where it all went downhill. Where most banks would have someone you could speak with quickly to update and re-send, they don’t have that option. You need to use the app’s chat function. It took 3 days for someone to respond to my initial message, but apparently the issue was too difficult for that agent, so they needed a “specialist” to get involved. More than two weeks later waiting for someone to get back to me and multiple “we’re so sorry, we guarantee a specialist will get back to you ASAP,” I asked them to close my account. They assured me again it would be resolved quickly, but there was nothing they could do in the meantime. After 3 weeks from my application, I received an email from someone called Eugene telling me that not only did they close my account, but I will never be allowed to open an account with them again? Updating an address for a client is a basic task for any bank. For this company, it may get you banned.

title: No support for Plaid
text:
As someone who uses Copilot budgeting app, Plaid support is crucial and how my local credit union can have support for Plaid, but a fintech company like Monzo not, is beyond me. I’ve been using Monzo for the past two months as my primary bank and not being able to use my budgeting app of choice is incredibly frustrating. What worse is that on Monzo’s development roadmap, Plaid support falls low on the list and it doesn’t seem to be a priority at all. Granted, Monzo has built in budgeting tools, but they pale in comparison to something like Copilot. So while I’m not going to close my account, I will switch back to my credit union in the mean time. 
Aside that, the app has a nice interface and the pots feature is quite nice as well.

title: Best neobank since Simple was shutdown by the piranhas
text: Monzo USA is the best neobank since Simple Bank was shutdown by the piranhas. I have opened accounts with One, Envel, Discover, BBVA, PNC and CFCU and none come remotely close to offering the features Simple had, except Monzo USA. That said, the lack of access from a standard PC, except for the bare essential and feature limited (read nonexistent) emergency browser, is a major limiter and prevents me from using Monzo for all my finances as I was able to with Simple Bank. As such, I use Monzo daily while at the same time searching monthly for a replacement nenobank that has all the features Simple Bank offered before being shutdown.

title: Best bank ever
text:
Guys, if you’re sick of the traditional big banks you need to try Monzo.  I’ve been banking with them for over a year now and if I have a question their online chat is always there to help me. 
If you travel you want their card.  No international transaction fees and each foreign transaction is charged at the mid-market exchange rate. No arbitrage or hidden fees.  
This needs to be your bank.

title: Great and getting better
text: I love the Monzo team for the way they think about money. Monzo is not just a banking app, it’s a budgeting app. It does so much more than an average banking app would do, and everything it does, it does truly great. There are certain features that any bank has, but Monzo doesn’t. That’s something that is a little disappointing, but I still prefer this over the other options. I appreciate that they are continuing to develop it.

title: A lifesaver for banking & budgeting
text: I absolutely love Monzo! I’ve been a customer for a few years now and honestly would be lost without them. Their envelope budgeting tool (Pots) has been essential to me for saving and budgeting my money plus so much more. I highly recommend Monzo! I haven’t had a brick & mortar bank in years and I do not miss it at all.

title: Amazing Customer Service and Fraud Dept.!
text: After using this Monzo app for one account as a trial run, I’m ready to move all of my accounts over from a big bank that I’ve been with for a long time. The response time and customer focused app is refreshing and much appreciated. They really make you feel like they care!

title: Great so far
text: I love Monzo so far. Everything is quick and intuitive. Every once in a while it’ll take a bit longer than usual to refresh balances. Shoutout to front and back end engineers for their work on this!

title: Great to use internationally
text:
I find the US Monzo account limited with its offerings BUT on my first trip after COVID-19 I used it all throughout Europe and it is FANTASTIC! 

There are NO international MasterCard fees and they give you a reasonable exchange rate. When you pay, choose “USD” not the local currency and Monzo does the exchange. 

I love the fact it breaks down the purchases into categories. 

Also, Europe is notorious for ATM card skimming. By keeping a lower balance on my Monzo I limit my risk. I also use it instead of my regular bank card for cash withdrawals. 

I must say I like it and it’s practically the only card I use. Would love to see them do a Credit Card like Chime as you need a CC for many airlines and hotels

App is recommended
